text: Eva Moser (26 July 1982 â€“ 31 March 2019) was an Austrian chess player. She was awarded the titles International Master (IM), in 2004, and Woman Grandmaster (WGM), in 2003, by FIDE. She was the first woman to win the Austrian Chess Championship in 2006.That is, the main championship open to men and women. She also won the Austrian women's championship in 2010 and 2011. She competed in the Women's World Chess Championship (WWCC) in 2008. She was born in Tamsweg, Salzburg. Moser died of leukaemia on 31 March 2019 in Graz. She was 36. ==References== ==Other websites== * Eva Moser chess games at 365Chess.com Category:1982 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Austrian sportspeople Category:Cancer deaths in Austria Category:Chess players Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:People from Salzburgerland
title: Eva Moser
